responsibilities: Push the boundaries of AI in education to assist teachers and improve student outcomes.
Personalize teaching experiences using AI technologies.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and implement AI solutions.
Stay updated with the latest AI trends and practices to maintain state-of-the-art solutions.
qualifications: Proficiency in Python programming and version control.
Strong understanding of generative AI technologies, including prompt engineering, Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), fine-tuning, and evaluation of large language model applications.
Excellent communication skills for effective collaboration with cross-functional teams.
Familiarity with software engineering practices such as Test-Driven Development (TDD) and CI/CD pipelines.
analysis:
The job responsibilities include pushing the boundaries of AI in education, personalizing teaching experiences using AI technologies, and staying updated with the latest AI trends. These responsibilities suggest a focus on innovative AI applications, which could involve generative AI or language models. 

The skills section explicitly mentions a strong understanding of generative AI technologies, including prompt engineering, Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), fine-tuning, and evaluation of large language model applications. This clearly indicates that the job involves working with generative AI and large language models. Additionally, proficiency in Python and familiarity with software engineering practices are supportive skills for implementing AI solutions.

Overall, both the responsibilities and skills sections strongly suggest that the job involves working with generative AI and language models.
